intro: Astragalus bourgovii, commonly known as the Bourgogne milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Astragalus bourgovii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest in ecological restoration projects.
